medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1, a 70-year-old man, had been unwell since October 5, 2012, with fever, urinary retention, flank pain, diarrhea, renal colic, and urinary tract infection. On October 13, he was admitted with cardiac failure. Patient 2, aged 39, presented on October 28, 2012, with a 4-day history of fever, rigors, anorexia, and cough productive of blood-streaked sputum. Patient 3, a previously healthy 16-year-old, reported symptoms on November 3, 2012, including fever, malaise, sore throat, cough, and wheezing. Patient 4, aged 31, had an acute onset of fever, rigors, and blood-streaked sputum on November 4, 2012.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 had type 2 diabetes, ischemic heart disease, and hypertension. Patient 2 was a long-term smoker with a history of reactive airway disease. Patient 3 was previously healthy. Patient 4 was a smoker with no other coexisting illnesses.
medical_history.family_history: Family cluster of MERS-CoV infection; Patient 1 was the grandfather of Patients 2 and 3, and Patient 4 was the younger brother of Patient 2.
medical_history.social_history: Patient 1 traveled briefly to Bahrain six months prior to admission. Patient 4 attended the slaughtering of a camel on October 24.
